about_the_game:
This is a fully immersive VR Cabinet of Curiosities, or Wunderkammer, in the style and atmosphere of an old Victorian study. It contains hundreds of rare, exotic 3D objects in photoreal stunning detail, from skulls to insects, that can be picked up, examined, and interacted with. Every shelf and drawer holds new wonders.


⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀✣ ┈┈┈┈┈ Open these doors to open your mind. ┈┈┈┈┈ ✣

The objects in the room have been 3D scanned using photogrammetry from real world specimens from museums and found objects. Players will get to learn about, and be inspired by any of the hundreds of notable objects in the room, gaining knowledge about its origins and scientific background through a uniquely developed UI. The objects can be placed on a central table for further study, or examined under a magnifying glass.


✣ ┈┈┈┈ Every shelf and drawer is packed with inspiration to satisfy any curious soul. ┈┈┈┈ ✣

This immersive experience is for artists and explorers of the natural world, who may now see these wonderous curiosities collected from around the globe, in the comfort of their own home anytime they wish. This will be the absolute coolest VR museum or study room ever created, with new objects and interactions added all the time!

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i5-4590 / AMD Ryzen 5 1500X or greater
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 / AMD Radeon 400 Series or better
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i7
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 1080
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 4 GB available space

short_description: This is a fully immersive and interactive VR Experience set in a Victorian style Cabinet of Curiosities room, full of hundreds of highly detailed 3D scanned objects from the natural world, that can be picked up, examined, and explored like a museum without restrictions.
